name.en: Seminar on Science, Technology, Society, and Policy

department.ch: 法律與政府研究所碩士班

goal.ch:
科技與社會(Science, Technology, and Society)是一門跨領域的新興學科。有鑑於STS的重要性日增，這門課程希望把STS的觀點與法律、政治學門相互結合，以便提供同學一個較為整合性的理解。由於這是一門基礎課程，因此同學們修習前不需要具備任何背景知識。整個課程的設計，是希望透過課堂討論與參與，逐步引導各位認識STS的基本構思，並透過個案與實例來讓同學熟悉STS的分析技法。歡迎各位對科技議題有興趣，或是關注當代新興法律、政策議題的同學選修。


                                                                                                         

                                                                              STS (Science, Technology, and Society) is a rapidly growing discipline in the field of social sciences. However, public administration (PA) has traditionally paid little attention to most science-related issues. One reason for this is the common belief that science, particularly “Science” or “hard-science,“ falls solely within the purview of scientists, leaving minimal relevance for PA perspectives. In recent years, it has become increasingly evident that science and technology play an essential role in almost all areas of decision/policy-making. 

This course aims to deepen and broaden our understanding of science and technology as social activities. It seeks to explore significant theories within the STS framework. Throughout the course, we will endeavor to spotlight major concepts and literature from both PA and STS fields. By engaging with assigned readings, posing thought-provoking questions, and fostering discussions and debates, we hope to unveil a clearer relationship between these two fields. Consequently, a comprehensive view, i.e. “STS and Policy”, will serve as a guide for further research endeavors.

outline.ch:
單元一：緒論
-STS導論
-STS的哲學與社會學背景
-STS與法律、公行的關聯
單元二：理論
-強綱領
-行動者網絡理論
-科技的社會建構
單元三：科學與政策
-爭議研究
-專業知識與不確定性
-公眾理解科學
-循證政策
單元四：課堂報告
單元五：結語
Unit I: Introduction
1. An introduction to STS
2. The philosophical background of STS
3. The sociological background of STS
4. STS and Law/Policy
Unit II: Basic Theories
5. The Strong Programme
6. ANT (Actor-Network Theory)
7. ANT Cases
8. SCOT (the social construction of technology)
Unit III: Science and Policy
9. Controversy Studies
10. Expertise and uncertainty
11. Public understanding of science
12. Evidence-based policy
Unit IV: Presentations
13. Group/individual 1
14. Group/individual  2
15. Group/individual  3
Unit V: Concluding remarks
16. Revisiting the relation between STS and PA
17. Self-learning week
18. Self-learning week

textbook.ch:

2. Yearley, S. (2005). Making Sense of Science: Understanding the social study of science, London: Sage.
3. Lewens, T. (2015). The meaning of science. London: Pelican.
4. Cole, S. A., ＆ Bertenthal, A. (2017). Science, Technology, Society, and Law. Annual Review of 
Law and Social Science, 13(1), 351-371.
5. Johns, F. (2021). Governance by Data. Annual Review of Law and Social Science, 17(1), 53-71.
6. Levy, K., Chasalow, K. E., ＆ Riley, S. (2021). Algorithms and Decision-Making in the Public 
Sector. Annual Review of Law and Social Science, 17(1), 309-334.
